columns.text: In this problem, we will determine the best alternative between leasing and purchasing in planning to obtain a new car. Additionally, if we intend to sell the car after three years, we will calculate the break-even sale of the vehicle.
To determine the superior alternative in obtaining the new car, we will calculate and compare the present value cost of leasing versus buying the vehicle.

We will compute the present value of leasing the car for the first calculation.

The vehicle offer's an arrangement that requires a downpayment of $4,300 today and $505 each month for the next three years with an annual percentage rate of 6%. Hence in calculating the present value of leasing the car, we will consider the following details:

| Particulars    |           |
|----------------|-----------|
| Downpayment    | $4,300    |
| Period payment | $505      |
| APR  | 6%        |
| Period         | 36 (month) |

Note that the period is in months since the periodic payment is monthly due.
In determining the present value cost of leasing, we will get the present value of the periodic monthly payment of $505 and add the downpayment required.

We will use the present value of an annuity formula in determining the present value of the periodic payment. Our calculation will use the following equation:

$$ \begin{aligned}
PVA &=C\times\dfrac{1-\dfrac{1}{\left(1+r\right)^t}}{r}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$PVA$, which means the present value of an annuity,\
$C$, which represent the periodic payment\
$r$, which refers to the discount rate\
$t$, which symbolizes the period of the annuity

Let's now determine the cost of leasing the car.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{PV cost of leasing} &= \$16,599.86+\$4,300
\\[10pt]
&= \boxed{\bf\$20,899.86}
\end{aligned}$$

Based on our calculation, after considering the constant payment for three years and the downpayment, the present value cost of leasing the vehicle is $20,899.86.

For the following calculation, let's identify the present value cost of purchasing the car.

Purchasing the vehicle means owning and having all the exclusive rights on the asset, including selling it. If we intend to sell the car after three years, we will consider the salvage value of the vehicle in our calculation.

We will consider the following details in calculating the present value cost of purchasing the car.

| Particulars    |           |
|----------------|-----------|
| Cost of the car    | $43,000    |
| Salvage value after | $28,000      |
| APR  | 6%        |
| Period         | 36 (months) |

Note that the period is monthly since the payment in purchasing the car is still monthly.

First, calculate the present value of the salvage value after three years of discounting it monthly of the 6% APR. 

The present value refers to the current value of future cash after considering the discount rate and the compounding period. The formula in this calculation is as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{PV} &=\dfrac{{FV}}{\left(1 + r\right)^{t}}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$FV$, which refers to the future value\
$t$, which represent the period\
$r$, which indicate the discount rate

Let's now determine the present value cost of purchase.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{PV Cost of Purchasing} &= \$43,000-\$23,398.06
\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{\bf\$19,601.94}
\end{aligned}$$

**Therefore, the present value cost of purchasing the car is $19,601.94.**

Based on our calculations, in obtaining the car, the cost of leasing the vehicle is $20,899.86, while purchasing it will cost $19,601.94.

**As we can observe, the cost of purchasing the car is significantly lower than leasing. Buying the vehicle provides a net advantage of  $1,297.92 over leasing; hence, purchasing the car is better.**

For the subsequent computation, we will determine the break-even resale price of the vehicle after three years.

In determining the breakeven resale price of the vehicle, we will consider the following details:

| Particulars    |           |
|----------------|-----------|
| Cost of the car    | $43,000    |
| PV of periodic payments | $20,899.86  |
| APR  | 6%        |
| Period         | 36 (month) |

First, let's calculate the present value of the vehicle's resale price after three years. We will subtract the present value of the periodic payment for the three years we calculated in the previous calculation to the cost of the car. Hence, will use the following equation:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{PV Resale Price} &= \text{Cost of the Car}-PVA
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

PV, which refers to the present value\
$PVA$, which identifies the present value of an annuity

Let's now determine the resale price present value.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{PV Resale Price} &= \$43,000-\$20,899.86
\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{\$22,100.14}
\end{aligned}$$

As can be seen in our calculation, the present value of the car's resale price is $22,100.14.

Next, we will assume the result of our calculation from the previous step as the present value and compute the future value to determine the break-even resale price of the car.

The future value refers to the value of cash at a future date by considering the present value today multiplied by the factor of rate and period. The future value can be calculated using the equation as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
FV&=PV\times\left(1 + r\right)^{t}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$FV$, which refers to the future value\
$PV$, which identifies the future value\
$t$, which represent the period\
$r$, which indicate the discount rate

To conclude, in obtaining the car among the two alternatives between buying or leasing the vehicle, buying is preferred since it offers lower costs when we compare the present value cost of the two. Last, based on our calculation, the breakeven resale price of the car after three years is $26446.80.
